metadata.synopsis: The Emperor has given the player a moment to talk with their party before choosing what to do (transform into a mind flayer, assimilate orpheus). If Lae'zel is on the Vlaakith path, she will have her own dialog instead of a discussion with the entire party,
metadata.how_to_trigger: load END_Maindebug recruit Lae'zel & KarlachProceed to Astral PlaneSpeak with Emperor till he offers the option to transformDialog should become available after the Emperor temporarly ends the dialog

4.speaker: Lae'zel
4.text: Mother Gith's only son has suffered long in his prison.
4.context: NodeContext: VAHR-ith-inn (a kind of psionic builder)

27.speaker: Lae'zel
27.text: Refuse the Emperor. Better yet, crush his revolting skull and let this Prism be his grave.

20.speaker: Lae'zel
20.text: Then smash the crystals with the Orphic Hammer, and free the Prince from his bonds.

24.speaker: Lae'zel
24.text: The Comet will guide us to a sure victory against the brain. Ch'mar, zal'a Orpheus!

5.speaker: Lae'zel
5.text: The choice before is clear as a var'ith'n's psi-quartz, inescapable as the expanse of wildspace itself.
5.context: NodeContext: VAHR-ith-inn (a kind of psionic builder)

52.speaker: Lae'zel
52.text: Smash the crystals with the Orphic Hammer. Once the fell prince is free, we'll strike him down. The Age of Vlaakith will last eternal!

15.speaker: Player
15.text: *Killing Orpheus would leave you without his protection. You would be dooming yourself to be the Netherbrain's thrall.*

68.speaker: Narrator
68.text: *Killing Orpheus would leave you without his protection. You would be dooming yourself to be the Netherbrain's thrall.*

54.speaker: Narrator
54.text: *Killing Orpheus would leave you without his protection. You would be dooming yourself to be the Netherbrain's thrall.*

40.speaker: Narrator
40.text: *But within the recesses of your mind, another possibility sparks:*

34.speaker: Narrator
34.text: *You might break Orpheus free with the hammer and ally with him. Together, you might defeat the Netherbrain.*

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *Afterwards, Lae'zel can strike down Prince Orpheus. Vlaakith's bidding will be done.*

48.text: *Letting him live, however, would surely provoke Lae'zel to attack.*

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *Letting him live, however, would surely provoke Lae'zel to attack.*

42.speaker: Narrator
42.text: *If you speak with Orpheus, you might unveil an option you have yet to consider.*

56.speaker: Lae'zel
56.text: To become ghaik - it is an agony that haunts every githyanki's dreams.

14.speaker: Lae'zel
14.text: It is the fate you and I have spent countless days trying to avoid since the parasites slithered into our skulls.

51.speaker: Lae'zel
51.text: And now it is the fate it seems you must accept, if we're to fell the unfaithful prince and fulfil Vlaakith's mission.

61.speaker: Lae'zel
61.text: Assimilate Orpheus, wield his power. Vlaakith's knights will fly to our aid - we will slaughter the brain, end the Grand Design...

3.speaker: Lae'zel
3.text: ...and I will speak the Rite of Ascension and fly to the Astral Plane.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: You could be right. Assimilating Orpheus might be the best option.

6.speaker: Lae'zel
6.text: Odious words, but I must speak them: in this matter, I believe the Emperor speaks true.

19.speaker: Lae'zel
19.text: But that does not mean I wish an illithid to carry Orpheus' power. Better it lives within you than within it.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: I'm not so sure. The Emperor offered; we should accept.

60.speaker: Lae'zel
60.text: A repugnant choice, a cowardly choice.

17.speaker: Lae'zel
17.text: But a choice I will not resist should you make it.

43.speaker: Lae'zel
43.text: Protocol Twenty: 'No alliance is above you nor beneath you if in service to Vlaakith's command.'

41.speaker: Player
41.text: If you're so adamant, why don't you assimilate Orpheus, Lae'zel?

22.speaker: Lae'zel
22.text: Tsk'va! Deny my own ascension and become that which Queen Vlaakith abhors?

50.speaker: Lae'zel
50.text: If I must be enthralled, then I will at least know the pleasure of tearing the prince apart with my own hands.

49.speaker: Lae'zel
49.text: And I will rip apart your own flesh if you refuse me and find a way to let Orpheus go free.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: I know what I need to do.

67.speaker: Lae'zel
67.text: Go. Choose what is right. Choose assimilation.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: You expect me to make a sacrifice you wouldn't make yourself?

63.speaker: Lae'zel
63.text: And you expect me to sacrifice a lifetime of faith? To forget ascension, to give up the very stuff I am made from?

25.speaker: Lae'zel
25.text: I would sooner donate my body to the Netherbrain as a ghaik puppet than live some half-life as a tentacled castaway.

66.speaker: Lae'zel
66.text: Either Orpheus is assimilated. Or I slay him in Vlaakith's name, and the Netherbrain takes our minds and bodies for its own.

33.speaker: Lae'zel
33.text: Either Orpheus is assimilated. Or the Netherbrain takes our minds and bodies for its own.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Connect with Lae'zel's mind. Could there be another reason for her refusal?

31.speaker: Narrator
31.text: *Lae'zel's other reasons for refusing her own assimilation come into focus:*

55.speaker: Narrator
55.text: *Lae'zel's other reasons for refusing her own assimilation come into focus:*

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *She fears the Emperor's influence on her mind. She trusts you with this power more than she trusts herself.*

0.speaker: Lae'zel
0.text: So you've seen the truth. Perhaps I shouldn't have been so shamed by it.

46.speaker: Lae'zel
46.text: You led us through briar and bramble, you affirmed my faith when it faltered.

2.speaker: Lae'zel
2.text: I hate that this gift must also be such a burden. But I would trust no one else with it.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: The Emperor could be lying. We could use the hammer to free Orpheus and kill him.

9.speaker: Lae'zel
9.text: Refuse assimilation, and we shall do just that. If the Emperor has misled us, our beating hearts and sound minds will be the proof of it.

47.speaker: Lae'zel
47.text: If the illithid speaks true and we slay the traitor, we will be lost to the void that is the Netherbrain.

35.speaker: Lae'zel
35.text: Odious words, but I must speak them: in this matter alone, I believe the illithid.

7.speaker: Lae'zel
7.text: I will fulfil my mission, this much I know. Either Orpheus is assimilated, or I carve him into pieces and we're lost to the Netherbrain's void.

64.speaker: Lae'zel
64.text: By Mother Gith's silver blade, are we left with no choice but to assimilate the Prince of the Comet?

65.speaker: Lae'zel
65.text: No, for as long as I live, I will not let Gith's only son perish. Let Orpheus be consumed, and I will split both you and the ghaik straight down the middle!

58.speaker: Player
58.text: *Lae'zel's words sound final, but within the recesses of your mind, a realisation sparks:*

11.speaker: Narrator
11.text: *Lae'zel's words sound final, but within the recesses of your mind, a realisation sparks:*

29.speaker: Narrator
29.text: *Lae'zel's words sound final, but within the recesses of your mind, a realisation sparks:*

57.speaker: Narrator
57.text: *When you next speak to the Emperor, you might still convince Lae'zel to accept Orpheus' assimilation.*

62.text: *Lae'zel's words sound final. Any move to assimilate Orpheus could provoke her to attack.*

59.speaker: Narrator
59.text: *Lae'zel's words sound final. Any move to assimilate Orpheus could provoke her to attack.*
